meanings.definition: A person who saves or rescues others.
meanings.sent1: The brave saviours rushed into the burning building to rescue the trapped family.
meanings.sent2: The saviours were hailed as heroes for their courageous actions.
meanings.sent3: The saviours in the action movie seemed to have superhuman strength and speed.
meanings.sent4: To the lost hiker, the rescue team appeared as saviours sent from above.
meanings.sent5: The saviours' selfless acts of heroism will always be remembered by the community.

meanings.definition: The act of saving or rescuing someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The swift saviours of the coast guard saved the drowning swimmer just in time.
meanings.sent2: The saviours of the forest worked tirelessly to protect endangered species.
meanings.sent3: In the comedy skit, the clumsy saviours kept tripping over their own feet during the rescue mission.
meanings.sent4: The saviours of the environment planted trees to combat deforestation.
meanings.sent5: The concept of saviours in fairy tales often involves magical creatures coming to the rescue.
